constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 53 (Thursday, March 24, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Ms. WILD:
H.R. 7230.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Under Article I, Section 8 of the Constitution, Congress
has the power ``to make all Laws which shall be necessary and
proper for carrying into Execution the foregoing Powers, and
all other Powers vested by this Constitution in the
Government of the United States, or any Department or Officer
thereof''.
[Page H3865]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

title: Family Health Care Affordability Act of 2022
